amendment.description: To create a point of order against legislation that would raise taxes on middle class families by double-taxing income already taxed at the state or local level.

action.text: Amendment SA 1141 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive section 305(b)(2) of the CBA with respect to amendment SA 1141 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 52. Record Vote Number: 227.
Point of order that the amendment violates section 305(b)(2) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 1141.

Amendment SA 1141 proposed by Senator Cantwell to Amendment SA 1116. (consideration: CR S6603-6604; text: CR S6603) To create a point of order against legislation that would raise taxes on middle class families by double-taxing income already taxed at the state or local level.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive section 305(b)(2) of the CBA with respect to amendment SA 1141 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 52. Record Vote Number: 227.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1141 proposed by Senator Cantwell to Amendment SA 1116.
